content: You're not alone, governor. Obama is bringing economic suicide to the rest of America as well. quote: Gov. Jim Gibbons said today that President Obama has denied his request to meet with him in Las Vegas later this month. "I am disappointed at the hypocrisy shown by this administration," Gibbons said in a prepared statement. "President Obama is coming to Las Vegas later this month for a political fundraiser, but he will not help the struggling families in Las Vegas and Nevada who are out of work because of his reckless comments." The Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority reports over 400 conventions and business meetings scheduled to take place in Las Vegas recently have cancelled. These cancelled events translate into 111,800 guests in Las Vegas and over 250,000 “room-nights”. The cancelled conventions and meetings have cost the Las Vegas economy over $100-million, not including gaming revenue. "This is politics, pure and simple, President Obama stood for change, but all he has done is brought negative economic change to Nevada," Gibbons said. "http://www.ktnv.com/Global/story.asp?S=10383051" "The World's Finest"
quote: Gov. Jim Gibbons said today that President Obama has denied his request to meet with him in Las Vegas later this month. "I am disappointed at the hypocrisy shown by this administration," Gibbons said in a prepared statement. "President Obama is coming to Las Vegas later this month for a political fundraiser, but he will not help the struggling families in Las Vegas and Nevada who are out of work because of his reckless comments." The Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority reports over 400 conventions and business meetings scheduled to take place in Las Vegas recently have cancelled. These cancelled events translate into 111,800 guests in Las Vegas and over 250,000 “room-nights”. The cancelled conventions and meetings have cost the Las Vegas economy over $100-million, not including gaming revenue. "This is politics, pure and simple, President Obama stood for change, but all he has done is brought negative economic change to Nevada," Gibbons said. "http://www.ktnv.com/Global/story.asp?S=10383051"
reply: You're not alone, governor. Obama is bringing economic suicide to the rest of America as well.  "The World's Finest"
title: Obama Stood For Change, But All He's Brought Is Negative Economic Change

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I'm starting to like Obama as President. Now he is making all SUV's, trucks, and cars in the US get at least 35 miles per gallon of gas by 2016. Thank God. I can't wait to drive my Shelby GT 500 Mustang down interstate 95 and get 35 miles per gallon coasting at 80 mph. I told you all a year or two ago that the Toyota Prius is here to stay. You could put a direct injection 4-cyl turbo charged engine in the Shelby, cut the weight down to 2,500 pounds (the engine alone weighs almost 1,000 pounds with the 5.4L iron block and blower) and it could get better than CAFE standard mileage averages. Europe has been making efficient and economical cars for decades. It's about time we caught up. Good for Obama. We may be able to salvage the American Auto Industry yet. (Or were SUVs supposed to do that?)

content: quote: Originally posted by Kegler300: You're not alone, governor. Obama is bringing economic suicide to the rest of America as well. quote: Gov. Jim Gibbons said today that President Obama has denied his request to meet with him in Las Vegas later this month. "I am disappointed at the hypocrisy shown by this administration," Gibbons said in a prepared statement. "President Obama is coming to Las Vegas later this month for a political fundraiser, but he will not help the struggling families in Las Vegas and Nevada who are out of work because of his reckless comments." The Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority reports over 400 conventions and business meetings scheduled to take place in Las Vegas recently have cancelled. These cancelled events translate into 111,800 guests in Las Vegas and over 250,000 “room-nights”. The cancelled conventions and meetings have cost the Las Vegas economy over $100-million, not including gaming revenue. "This is politics, pure and simple, President Obama stood for change, but all he has done is brought negative economic change to Nevada," Gibbons said. "http://www.ktnv.com/Global/story.asp?S=10383051" I love the way the Repubs are trying to blame this all on Obama as if nothing they did in the previous years had any effect. Do Repubs really think their party was that ineffective?. Obama's FIRST budget doesn't even go into effect until Oct. 2009, we are STILL using the last Bush admin budget. US Fiscal Year: 1 October - 30 September
quote: Originally posted by Kegler300: You're not alone, governor. Obama is bringing economic suicide to the rest of America as well. quote: Gov. Jim Gibbons said today that President Obama has denied his request to meet with him in Las Vegas later this month. "I am disappointed at the hypocrisy shown by this administration," Gibbons said in a prepared statement. "President Obama is coming to Las Vegas later this month for a political fundraiser, but he will not help the struggling families in Las Vegas and Nevada who are out of work because of his reckless comments." The Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority reports over 400 conventions and business meetings scheduled to take place in Las Vegas recently have cancelled. These cancelled events translate into 111,800 guests in Las Vegas and over 250,000 “room-nights”. The cancelled conventions and meetings have cost the Las Vegas economy over $100-million, not including gaming revenue. "This is politics, pure and simple, President Obama stood for change, but all he has done is brought negative economic change to Nevada," Gibbons said. "http://www.ktnv.com/Global/story.asp?S=10383051"
reply: I love the way the Repubs are trying to blame this all on Obama as if nothing they did in the previous years had any effect. Do Repubs really think their party was that ineffective?. Obama's FIRST budget doesn't even go into effect until Oct. 2009, we are STILL using the last Bush admin budget. US Fiscal Year: 1 October - 30 September
title: Obama Stood For Change, But All He's Brought Is Negative Economic Change

content: I'm starting to like Obama as President. Now he is making all SUV's, trucks, and cars in the US get at least 35 miles per gallon of gas by 2016. Thank God. I can't wait to drive my Shelby GT 500 Mustang down interstate 95 and get 35 miles per gallon coasting at 80 mph. I told you all a year or two ago that the Toyota Prius is here to stay.

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I'm starting to like Obama as President. Now he is making all SUV's, trucks, and cars in the US get at least 35 miles per gallon of gas by 2016. Thank God. I can't wait to drive my Shelby GT 500 Mustang down interstate 95 and get 35 miles per gallon coasting at 80 mph. I told you all a year or two ago that the Toyota Prius is here to stay. You could put a direct injection 4-cyl turbo charged engine in the Shelby, cut the weight down to 2,500 pounds (the engine alone weighs almost 1,000 pounds with the 5.4L iron block and blower) and it could get better than CAFE standard mileage averages. Europe has been making efficient and economical cars for decades. It's about time we caught up. Good for Obama. We may be able to salvage the American Auto Industry yet. (Or were SUVs supposed to do that?)
quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I'm starting to like Obama as President. Now he is making all SUV's, trucks, and cars in the US get at least 35 miles per gallon of gas by 2016. Thank God. Europe has been making efficient and economical cars for decades. It's about time we caught up. Good for Obama. We may be able to salvage the American Auto Industry yet. (Or were SUVs supposed to do that?)

Do Repubs really think their party was that ineffective?. Obama's FIRST budget doesn't even go into effect until Oct. 2009, we are STILL using the last Bush admin budget. US Fiscal Year: 1 October - 30 September It's funny how they get excited about the last administration being blamed for the economy. Obama hasn't even made it through his first year and the blame him, much less two terms.
quote: Originally posted by rayld2: I love the way the Repubs are trying to blame this all on Obama as if nothing they did in the previous years had any effect. Do Repubs really think their party was that ineffective?. Obama's FIRST budget doesn't even go into effect until Oct. 2009, we are STILL using the last Bush admin budget. US Fiscal Year: 1 October - 30 September
reply: It's funny how they get excited about the last administration being blamed for the economy. Obama hasn't even made it through his first year and the blame him, much less two terms.
title: Obama Stood For Change, But All He's Brought Is Negative Economic Change

content: I'm starting to like Obama as President. Now he is making all SUV's, trucks, and cars in the US get at least 35 miles per gallon of gas by 2016. Thank God. I can't wait to drive my Shelby GT 500 Mustang down interstate 95 and get 35 miles per gallon coasting at 80 mph. I told you all a year or two ago that the Toyota Prius is here to stay.
reply: I'm starting to like Obama as President. Now he is making all SUV's, trucks, and cars in the US get at least 35 miles per gallon of gas by 2016. Thank God. content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I'm starting to like Obama as President. Now he is making all SUV's, trucks, and cars in the US get at least 35 miles per gallon of gas by 2016. Thank God. I can't wait to drive my Shelby GT 500 Mustang down interstate 95 and get 35 miles per gallon coasting at 80 mph. I told you all a year or two ago that the Toyota Prius is here to stay. You could put a direct injection 4-cyl turbo charged engine in the Shelby, cut the weight down to 2,500 pounds (the engine alone weighs almost 1,000 pounds with the 5.4L iron block and blower) and it could get better than CAFE standard mileage averages. Europe has been making efficient and economical cars for decades. It's about time we caught up. Good for Obama. We may be able to salvage the American Auto Industry yet. (Or were SUVs supposed to do that?)
quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I'm starting to like Obama as President. Now he is making all SUV's, trucks, and cars in the US get at least 35 miles per gallon of gas by 2016. Thank God. I can't wait to drive my Shelby GT 500 Mustang down interstate 95 and get 35 miles per gallon coasting at 80 mph. I told you all a year or two ago that the Toyota Prius is here to stay.

Europe has been making efficient and economical cars for decades. It's about time we caught up. Good for Obama. We may be able to salvage the American Auto Industry yet.
